column8: text

Saying no to graft: Mohd Irwan (centre) reciting the graft-free pledge at the Finance Ministry Complex in Putrajaya. With him are Mohd Isa (left) and Shamsun Baharin. Staff of the Finance Ministry – the country’s main purse holder – have pledged to make corruption and abuse of power their common enemy.Seventeen staff members from the ministry’s senior management signed the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission’s (MACC) graft-free pledge yesterday.Led by deputy secretary-general (investment) Datuk Seri Dr Mohd Isa Hussain, the staff members vowed to be committed to ensuring transparency and accountability in all dealings made during their course of duty.The signing was witnessed by Treasury secretary-general Tan Sri Dr Mohd Irwan Serigar Abdullah and MACC’s deputy chief commissioner (prevention) Datuk Shamsun Baharin Mohd Jamil.Mohd Irwan said besides ministry staff, employees of its agencies had also volunteered to sign the pledgehttp://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2017...uzZtOisGRZIr.99
wayang kemain
i declare myself, corruption free
Now we need to announce to the whole world if we want to be honest and high in integrity?

how long they all serve in the department ?Ministry of FinanceThis Ministry, including the Treasury, comprise the following agencies:Accountant-General's Department (ANM)Property Assessment and Services Department (JPPH)Royal Malaysian Customs Department (JKDM) (Website)Bank Simpanan Nasional* (BSN) (Website)Bursa Malaysia Berhad** (Website)Central Bank of Malaysia* (BNM) (Website)Employees’ Provident Fund* (KWSP/EPF) (Website)Inland Revenue Board* (LHDN)Khazanah Nasional Berhad** (Website)Labuan Financial Services Authority* (Labuan FSA)Langkawi Development Authority* (LADA)Malaysian Totalisator Board*Public Sector Housing Financing Authority* (LPPSA)Retirement Fund, Inc.* (KWAP)Securities Commission* (SC)Yayasan Tun Razak** (YTR)only 17 SEVENTEEN ppl signbetter than DAP no one want to sign

Anti curroption culture...Just enforcement is not enough... corruption is a mindset.. to shift the mindset we must adjust the culture surrounding it...That is what MACC is trying to do...The pledge is a crucial voluntary first step towards the commitment.... which will open the door to more significant voluntary action later on..If first step already fail,  you practically can see already what the mindset is about corruption..This commandable effort by MACC and those that took the pledge...
By default police force and the whole judiciary wing is redundant as all citizen should follow the law..
The authorities (pulis, court, MACC) are there to catch & punish the corrupt citizens. So we'd expect all of them to be corruption free, and they don't need to tell us.

Like there are corrupt citizen.. there are also corrupt goverment workers...Nothing works by default only..... the pledge is needed not just to tell the citizen, but also to the staff on how commit the organizatin is to the cause..In fact i expect them to renew the pledge from time to time, how redundant that may sound....
